answers.answer: I would have to see a copy of your old and new glasses RX to see if there is really a big change.The things that cause rapid and often unusual changes in glasses are: diabetes, certain medications, wearing any type of contact lens, swelling of the macula.If you have not seen an eye MD please see one. Nothing in your glasses should cause you to be dizzy. Dizzy is not an eye symptom.JCH III MD

question: Why would my prescription change in less than 2 months?  I was told it could be my sugar levels but my fasting sugar level is 74.  What else could be causing this?  Also I have been dizzy for the last 6 months but the neurologist that I've been seeing says it's nothing.  My MRI is clear.  Should I have something else tested?
title: Prescription Change
